article.title: A Hard Look at the Neutron Stars and Accretion Disks in 4U 1636-53, GX 17+2, and 4U 1705-44 with $\emph {NuSTAR}$

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary method used in this article to constrain the radius of neutron stars?
According to Table 2, what is the inner disk radius (Rin) of 4U 1636-53 in units of ISCO, assuming a spin parameter (a*) of 0.3?
Based on Figure 3b, which source shows the strongest evidence for a truncated accretion disk?
choices: All sources show equal evidence for truncation.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main advantage of using NuSTAR for disk reflection studies, as mentioned in the article?
choices: Its ability to directly measure the neutron star\'s magnetic field.
Its high sensitivity at low X-ray energies, enabling precise boundary layer measurements.
Its broad bandpass allows for better characterization of the reflection spectrum and continuum.
Its high spatial resolution allows for resolving the accretion disk structure.
